> Hi Sai,
>
> My colleague Andre is out today on medical leave, but as we received a
> feedback from R&D, I would like to share it with you:
>
> The issue seems to be due to an incompatibility between Kaspersky (some
> feature(s) that activate a proxy service) and Endpoint Protector's "Deep
> Packet Inspection" feature (that is also based on a proxy service).
> There are differences between the unaffected and affected systems. The
> affected machine has a newer version of Kaspersky installed (12.0), the
> unaffected machine had (11.3).
> We noticed that the Kaspersky product changed its firewall rules between
> versions, having a dynamically changing products causes a challenge for
> interoperability also for Endpoint Protector as it can't always keep up
> with all the changes in conflicting products.
> As a workaround we suggest turning off the incompatible features in
> Kaspersky. We also suggest reaching out to Kaspersky to get their stance on
> the issue.
> We also suggest testing Endpoint Protector without Kaspersky installed, to
> rule out a problem on our side.
>
> Best regards,
>

Hi Sai,

My colleague Andre is out today on medical leave, but as we received a feedback from R&D, I would like to share it with you:

The issue seems to be due to an incompatibility between Kaspersky (some feature(s) that activate a proxy service) and Endpoint Protector's "Deep Packet Inspection" feature (that is also based on a proxy service).
There are differences between the unaffected and affected systems. The affected machine has a newer version of Kaspersky installed (12.0), the unaffected machine had (11.3).
We noticed that the Kaspersky product changed its firewall rules between versions, having a dynamically changing products causes a challenge for interoperability also for Endpoint Protector as it can't always keep up with all the changes in conflicting products.
As a workaround we suggest turning off the incompatible features in Kaspersky. We also suggest reaching out to Kaspersky to get their stance on the issue.
We also suggest testing Endpoint Protector without Kaspersky installed, to rule out a problem on our side.
